title: Tottenham Hotspur 'tell Inter Milan Jan Vertonghen is not for sale in January'
text:
Tottenham have told Inter Milan they will not consider selling Jan Vertonghen in January, but the Serie A club have not been deterred and will look to sign the defender next summer.

Inter are planning to sign Vertonghen for free when his contract runs out in June, and could make an approach the Belgium international in the new year in hope of reaching a pre-contract agreement.

The 32-year-old, who joined Spurs in 2012, is considering his options and is free to talk to other clubs as he enters the last six months of his contract.

Inter Milan are plotting a move to sign Tottenham's Jan Vertonghen for free next summer

According to The Guardian, Spurs are planning to offer the centre-back a new contract but Inter are readying a lucrative three-year deal.

Inter boss Antonio Conte recruited Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez from the Premier League in the summer, and it is believed Inter wanted to sign Vertonghen but were put off by his price tag.

Inter currently sit second in the Serie A table after nine games, a point behind leaders Juventus.

Tottenham are also at risk of losing playmaker Christian Eriksen for free when his contract expires in the summer.
